text: Is there any documentation on how to use the Pages API with the new themes / DnD structure? I’m working on upgrading our app from using `widget_container → widgets` to using `dnd_area → dnd_section / dnd_module`  but I can’t figure out how to structure my request.. :eyes:

Hi, I added HubSpot form to our website, which our client send to us. Everything is working,  but now I need to know how to send the data from this form to the client's email? So I have a question:

1. Can I do it by using HubSpot API? The easiest way to realize it and is it possible?
2. Maybe we can make some settings in a client profile, to put email somewhere and it will work?

I thought I need only import this form to the webpage, and everything is already has build in the constructor, but unfortunately not

I am trying to use create *contact* using CRM API. This is the endpoint I am using. this POST method */crm/v3/objects/contacts*
As per the doc, I am seeing below request parameters. I am not able understand these parameters for contact. Can anybody help ?

{
  "property_number": "17",
  "property_dropdown": "choice_b",
  "property_radio": "option_1",
  "property_string": "value",
  "property_multiple_checkboxes": "chocolate;strawberry",
  "property_checkbox": "false",
  "property_date": "1572480000000"
}

those are placeholder properties not to be taken literally, you need to use property names and values from here

<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/contacts/?hapikey=>...
You can't make custom objects in HubSpot. There are Idea posts for it. Can you be more specific?

It might be easier to use a Workflow or Alert of some kind for this to get HubSpot to make the emails. But you would be able to get new Contacts or Companies the form has made, and make an email yourself in your API code.
The webhooks are supposed to be lightweight, and you have to make followup API calls sometimes to load deeper data on the obj's seen in the webhook
Yeah, you might have to make a ticket to ask about if it's doing this on purpose for performance reasons
Thanks. Is the structure of the request a simple json object ?
Ah, yeah, I suspect those might not be exposed, and might need to raise it up in the forum or an idea
As I on;y saw APIs for first-level comments so far and not second level comments on comments

Yes, the sample you quoted in your question shows, for each property datatype, how to put them in that hash structure in the right format, the API will give you parse errors with some context what is wrong if you get the right overall structure but you have a buggy property value

We're moving our blog into HubSpot. I have all the posts created in HubSpot in an unpublished state. Each post has the correct `publish_date`. I'm verifying the publish date by querying the API for all posts. e.g. I see one post has a publish_date of `1561564800000`. However when I post to publish API, the post is published w/ the current time/date. I'm passing this in the POST body `{"action": "schedule-publish"}`, which says "sets up the content for publishing at the publish_date already set on the post.". Am I doing something wrong?
Trying to fetch the cms, but only getting command not found. Can someone paste a real line of command, I read all the documentation, so referring to that just won’t be of any help. Thanks!
